name: Multi-column Tag Map
author: Alan Jackson

sections.description:
Multi-column Tag Map displays a columnized and alphabetical (English) listing of all tags, categories, authors, pages, posts, single custom post types or taxonomies used in your site similar to the index page of a book. This makes it easier for your visitors to quickly search for topics that might intrest them. It’s a great alternative to the tag cloud and especially useful if you have a large site with a multitude of subjects, products etc…

Live examples and option details can be found at mctagmap.tugbucket.net

Features

  • Alphabetically lists tags, pages, posts, categories, custom post types, authors and taxonomies
  • Over 50 customizable options

Links

  • Options and Documentation
  • Support
sections.installation:
From your WordPress dashboard

  1. Visit Plugins > Add New
  2. Search for “Multi-column Tag Map”
  3. Activate Multi-column Tag Map from your Plugins page
  4. Read the documentation to get started

Shortcode Installation Example

[mctagmap show_pages="yes"]
sections.faq:
Nothing shows on the page where the shortcode is

Most likely this is a timeout or an out of memory issue. Fo rthe time being, increase your WP_MEMORY_LIMIT.

The plugin doesn’t work correctly in [insert non-english] language, can you fix it?

Currently the plugin only displays and groups non-English words. It does not sort these words alphabetically. If someone would like to help translate it into another language, it would be appreciated.

Does the plugin work in [insert theme name]?

mctagmap does nothing to the core functions of WordPress. There should be no reason that a theme changes the default functions as to how WordPress handles tags. Knowing that, there shouldn’t be any reason why the plugin does not work in your theme. The CSS might get overwritten due the the hierarchy of your themes CSS but, that can be changed by editing the mctagmap.css.

The map is displaying in a “stair case” fashion

In your admin panel for the page, switch to HTML view. Notice your theme is wrapping the shortcode in:

<pre><code> </code></pre>

Please remove that. That should fix it up.

Can the plugin include tags from [insert plugin name]?

Multi-column Tag Map looks for the tags created by WordPress. Most other plugins (NextGen, The Events Calendar, etc…) create tags but, they are not stored in the database the same way as WordPress does. Combining those tags into Multi-column Tag Map is possible but, any method of doing this is a hack and is not supported out of the box. I will not add this functionality to the plugin as a default since I have no control over the other plugins and cannot make any guarantee that the other plugins will not change how they structure and handle tags in the future.

WooCommerce

Use the right taxonomies. product_tag and product_cat or to show all products: show_posts=”yes” post_type=”product”

Please note this is not something made for WooCommerce. It’s simply pulling out of the database with core WP functions.

sections.reviews:
Very good and well documented.

By pabel on March 10, 2024

This plug in has a lot of flexibility and is well documented. I have enjoyed the options available to use and it has worked well for us for quite some time. He also seems to keep the plugin updated and that helps.

running smoothly

By geremol on March 9, 2024

is an easy-to-use plugin and runs smoothly. I have been using it for four years and I have not had a single problem.

Works! but it took over 4 weeks for a critical security issue to be fixed!

By psypat on October 1, 2023

I've used this a lot, but when a major security issue arose, it took over 4 weeks for the author to correct it...

That is not acceptable... Now I've moved along and are using another plugin!

Only plugin that does this right

By dunnpublishing on September 24, 2023

Actually, only one of two plugins, the other one being the one from Taxopress. But this one is much more flexible. The well-documented shortcodes let you get really granular with the appearance and sorting behavior.

Really complicated and confusing

By BeeCee (csigncsign) on June 6, 2023

It is really complicated and confusing to collect all the shortcodes and put them alltogether. It would be nice to have a kind of "generator" for such a long tail of possible shortcodes.

Useful plugin

By Lisa (Lisa Geerts) on September 23, 2022

This is the only plugin I have ever found that displays my tags beautifully. Thank you very much. It is so useful.

Extremely Useful Plugin / Responsive Support

By Rongo on January 22, 2022

Simply put, this is one of those plugins that should be included by default with Wordpress installations. At its basic core, it provides a simple, highly functional, visual sitemap/topical index to your categories and tags. More than that, however, it has near unlimited possibilities for providing both site readers and search engine spiders a means of quickly jumping to content. AND, if you have a multisite, you can use this plugin to create a map to all of your sites in a single index (or span multiple pages). Alan, the plugin's author is responsive to suggestions, and certainly quick to offer support. Frankly, this is one of those plugins that is so useful, you'd expect to pay for it.

Two Custom Post Types

By (kkriss) on November 26, 2021

With the 17.0.17 version you can also list two different CPTs. That's exactly what I needed, and I like so much how the layout is for a good UX. Thanx!

Powerful alternative to TOCs & Tagclouds

By rfkat on August 18, 2021

Had almost overlooked this plugin due to its title, which describes only part of its functionality. Extremely flexible shortcode, visually appealing results. The only thing I missed was a few demos that are not option-based, but goal-oriented, to see how the options are orchestrated for some typical use cases. Also, the lorem ipsum text that is used in the demos obscures a bit what is a tag, a category, a post/page excerpt, etc.

Amazing customization options!

By spiriadi on April 3, 2021

Thank you for this a wesome plugin! I have a question. How do I make sure that the "quotes", "dot" or "www" symbol is not taken when forming the list?
